thread.title: CU volleyball: Buffs fall to No. 13 Arizona State
thread.title_full: CU volleyball: Buffs fall to No. 13 Arizona State

author: BuffZone.com
title: CU volleyball: Buffs fall to No. 13 Arizona State
text:
CU volleyball: Buffs fall to No. 13 Arizona State BuffZone.com Posted: 10/24/2015 09:29:52 AM MDT 
The Buffaloes were unable to keep the magic going on Saturday as No. 13 Arizona State ended the University of Colorado's three-match win streak by defeating CU 3-1 (25-21, 8-25, 25-12, 25-23) at Wells Fargo Arena in Tempe, Arizona. 
The Buffs are now 13-9 overall, 5-5 in Pac-12 play, while ASU improved to 17-4 overall, 6-4 in the league. 
Senior Alexis Austin led CU with 15 kills and sophomore Gabby Simpson had nine kills. Sophomore Anna Pfefferle also added seven kills for the Buffs. 
CU hit .200 in the match with 42 kills and 21 errors on 105 attacks. Senior Nicole Edelman handed out 37 of CU's 40 assists. 
The Sun Devils hit just .162 with 43 kills and 24 errors on 117 attacks. BreElle Bailey had a match-high 16 kills. 
CU out-dug ASU 41-35. Junior Cierra Simpson recorded 16 digs, while Gabby Simpson added 10 digs. 
Both teams had 13 team blocks. Freshman Naghede Abu posted seven blocks, five solo and two assists, while Austin had three blocks, two solo and one assist. Gabby Simpson also had two block solos and one block assist. 
With Abu leading the way, the Buffs were able to knock off it No. 14 Arizona on Friday in Tucson, Ariz. The Buffs have now won three straight matches against Arizona (13-8, 3-6 Pac-12), including two matches in Tucson. The Wildcats have been ranked in all three of those contests. The win is also CU's fourth against a ranked opponent this season, its second on the road. Advertisement 
The Buffs return home to the Coors Events Center next weekend for matches against Oregon State and No. 25 Oregon next Oct. 30 and 31, respectively. 
CU soccer seeks to rebound 
The CU soccer team will attempt to rebound from a 2-1 loss to UCLA when the Buffs face No. 24 USC on Sunday in Los Angeles. The match will kick off at noon MT and will be televised live on the Pac-12 Network. 
The Buffs have won their past three meetings with the Trojans. 
Despite a strong defensive effort, fell to UCLA on Friday night. The Buffs' back line kept the Bruins from putting a shot on goal in the first half. 
"I thought our back four played really well tonight," CU coach Danny Sanchez said. "We only allowed two shots on goal and one was a penalty kick. Madison Krauser was exceptional back there and also on the attack. Heather Ward did very well moving the ball forward." 
Danica Evans scored CU's only goal in the 76th minute, heading in a corner from Joss Orejel to pull the Buffs even at 1-1. 
However, the match was tied for only 15 seconds as the Bruins drew a foul in the CU box following the kickoff. Annie Alvarado converted the ensuing penalty kick to give the lead back to UCLA at 2-1.
